instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840-A
threads.message:
hello,

I have an 820-00840-A motherboard, and there is no liquid damage. During my initial checks, I noticed that U3200 was getting hot, and I realized that there was a short circuit in the PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO line. I replaced U3200, but then I noticed that PI3USB32224BXEAE was getting hot. I removed this component, and I haven't been able to replace it yet. Currently, the motherboard is drawing 5V at 0.021A, and then it goes back to 5V at 0.000A - 5V at 0.021A continuously. Is it happening because PI3USB32224BXEAE is missing, or is it due to a different issue?

threads.title: 820-00840-A
threads.message: "I replaced the CD3215C on it with CD3215B. Will there be any issues? Also, these chips don't have any firmware on them, right? Because I installed a brand new product I bought from AliExpress."

threads.title: 820-00840-A
threads.message:
Put the correct "C" version; C00, I suppose.
B03 has different firmware.

threads.title: 820-00840-A
threads.message:
I have it on the donor a1706, can I use it? both sides are same
PI3USB32224BXEAE you didn't say anything about it

threads.title: 820-00840-A
threads.message:
Board can work without it.
Once booted, replace it; if you note USB 3.0 issues.
